gameplay.logic

Class GameLogic

  • java.lang.Object
    • gameplay.logic.GameLogic

  • public class GameLogic
extends java.lang.Object
    Class contains all calculation methods used during gameplay such as finding attackable tiles or checking if a move is legal. These methods are testable and return back to GameMain.
    See Also:
    GameMain

      Creates Obstacles to be placed within the middle region of the grid.
      void executeAttack(int attackPosY, int attackPosX)
      Executes an attack on the enemy unit and removes the unit from the game if hp is less than 0 And sets the unit who has attack with a boolean with the method setHasAttackThisTurn=true so that other methods that check through units for exporting attacks.
      java.util.ArrayList<Tile> getAttackableTiles()
      Checks for opponents within attack range and returns them in a ArrayList with tiles that have opponents units in them.
      java.util.ArrayList<Tile> getMovementPossibleTiles()
      Gets all possible tiles a unit is within range to move to.

    • Method Detail

      • checkForLegalMove

        public boolean checkForLegalMove(int newPosY,
                                 int newPosX,
                                 java.util.ArrayList<Tile> movementTargets)
        Checks to see if move is legal by checking if the move position player wants to move is one of the tiles returns in getMovementPossibleTiles() method.
        Parameters:
        newPosY - Takes in the y-position player wants to move piece relative to grid.
        newPosX - Takes in the x-position player wants to move piece relative to grid.
        movementTargets - Takes in a ArrayList with Tile objects
        Returns:
        boolean
        See Also:
        Grid, GameMain

      • checkForLegalAttack

        public boolean checkForLegalAttack(int attackPosY,
                                   int attackPosX,
                                   java.util.ArrayList<Tile> attackTargets)
        Checks to see if attack is legal by checking if the attack position player wants to attack is one of the tiles returns in getAttackableTiles() method.
        Parameters:
        attackPosY - Takes in a integer with the y-position relative to the Grid
        attackPosX - Takes in a integer with the x-position relative to the Grid.
        attackTargets - Takes in a ArrayList with tile objects.
        Returns:
        boolean
        See Also:
        Grid, GameMain

      • getMovementPossibleTiles

        public java.util.ArrayList<Tile> getMovementPossibleTiles()
        Gets all possible tiles a unit is within range to move to. Checks to see if move is legal and that there is no enemy unit or obstacle on the tile that are returned in a ArrayList.
        Returns:
        ArrayList with Tile objects

      • getAttackableTiles

        public java.util.ArrayList<Tile> getAttackableTiles()
        Checks for opponents within attack range and returns them in a ArrayList with tiles that have opponents units in them.
        Returns:
        ArrayList with Tile objects
        See Also:
        GameMain, Unit

      • checkForEliminationVictory

        public int checkForEliminationVictory()
        Checks if either player or opponent has been eliminated Returns 1 if user loses, 0 if opponent loses, else it returns -1
        Returns:
        int
        See Also:
        GameMain

      • executeAttack

        public void executeAttack(int attackPosY,
                          int attackPosX)
        Executes an attack on the enemy unit and removes the unit from the game if hp is less than 0 And sets the unit who has attack with a boolean with the method setHasAttackThisTurn=true so that other methods that check through units for exporting attacks. This method is usually called from another method, and never called alone.
        Parameters:
        attackPosY - Takes in the Y grid coordinates as an int
        attackPosX - Takes in the X grid coordinates as an int
        See Also:
        GameMain, Grid

      • createObstacles

        public java.util.ArrayList<Obstacle> createObstacles()
        Creates Obstacles to be placed within the middle region of the grid. Obstacle bound are the size of the grid -4 rows. 2 rows at the top for player 1, and 2 rows at the bottom for player 2. Player 2 creates the obstacle in the method addObstacles() in GameMain. This method uses a random generated number to place the obstacles. Finally this method calls upon db.exportObstacles() to export the obstacle postion to the database, so it will be synchronized for both players.
        Returns:
        ArrayList, returns an ArrayList with Obstacle objects.
        See Also:
        Database, GameMain, Obstacle
